ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: This course greatly improved my speaking skills and some of my writing skills. It also gave me a lot of confidence in my Arabic.
Incredible course for my ability to crank through and churn out material. Writing a fairly long piece of work feels so much more natural and automatic and I feel a lot more control over my output.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: This course gave me a comfortable opportunity to improve my Arabic. It is general structure and topics were fascinating.
I really enjoy the dual focus on media Arabic and literature, and the readings were always chosen for specific reasons and led to fantastic discussions.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: I would definitely recommend this course. Especially to students who wish to improve their conversation skills and presentations skills in Arabic.

My ratings on difficulty and workload are certainly influenced by the fact that I'm a non-native speaker-- even coming from a background where you speak a dialect at home will likely make it significantly easer. That being said, I wholeheartedly recommend this course. Professor Elbousty is fantastic, supportive, and incredibly passionate, and some of the conversations we had were fantastic. If you feel shaky on some grammar stuff, I still recommend going through with this-- you pick up a lot on the way, and it's a lot of fun to do-- just make sure to block out ample time for the readings in order to get the most out of class discussions and look over what you didn't understand after class by yourself.

Overall, could not recommend more for a higher-level Arabic course.
